Title: South Seattle College
Goal: Establish a community center with computer lab and job center
Progress Detail: Job center located at SSCC Georgetown Annex
Challenges and barriers: Have a community space in Georgetown City Hall

Goal: Multi-purpose facility to house job-training, English as a second language classes and other job networking opportunities…in conjunction with community center.

Title: Old City Hall
Goal: Mini-City Hall in Old City Hall with bulletin board, meeting rooms.
Progress Detail: Georgetown City Hall restoration completed and GCC given permanent use of one room and shared use of a large meeting room.  However, public access is not 24/7
Challenges and barriers: Current owners use most of the building

Title: Steam Plant
Goal: City support and endorsement of the Steam Plant Museum
Progress Detail: Seattle City Light is working on moving this forward
Challenges and barriers: SCL is still working with KCIA to establish permenant access to the site.
Next Steps: Work with SCL on their strategic plan for steam plant.

Goal: Mini branch Library
Progress Detail: New South Park branch precludes anything for Georgetown in the near future
Challenges and barriers: Neighborhood too small to support a new branch library
Next Steps: Bookmobile

Goal: Tree plantings
Progress Detail: Trees planted on Corson, Flora, Ellis, 8th Ave. Progress has been made. As of 2015, City has recommitted to neighborhood tree planting.
Challenges and barriers: Hardscaping all the way to the property line in the industrial zoned areas; No planting strip on Carleton
Next Steps: Identify more areas where trees can be planted; work with the city arborist to get permissions to plant

Goal: Neighborhood Clean-ups
Progress Detail: Spring cleanups annually
Challenges and barriers: Getting people to show up, coordinating, logistics
Next Steps: Keep up the good work!

Goal: Public art by local artists
Progress Detail: 8th Ave street end kiosk; Garden Hat installation at Oxbow; Graffitti wall facing 4th Ave. Festival St. art.
Challenges and barriers: Identifying sources of money, locating appropriate locations
Next Steps: Encourage community involvement

Goal: Community Festivals
Progress Detail: Carnival, History Tour, Garden Walk, Neighborhood BBQ

Goal: Anti-graffiti campaign
Progress Detail: DROF grant issed for this
Challenges and barriers: Ongoing gang/graffiti problem.

Goal: Expand and enhance Ruby Chow Park
Progress Detail: Work done to discourage semi-truck parking. Friends of Ruby Chow Park established.
Challenges and barriers: Ruby Chow blocked by airport expansion; County-owned land; Airport considers it an "art installation"
Next Steps: Include Ruby Chow in any future Pro-Parks levy

Title: Gateway Park
Goal: Expand and enhance Gateway Park
Progress Detail: Community chose to redirect efforts towards other projects. Duwamish River cleanup plan includes plans to create salmon habitat.
Challenges and barriers: Challenging partnering with local businesses to maintain street.
Next Steps: Need to follow up on the current ownership status of steam plant pumphouse.

Title: Baily Street
Goal: Develop safe connections to link Georgetown’s residential area south of Bailey with the Georgetown Playfield.
Challenges and barriers: Michigan Street heavy volume; high speeds coming off the freeway at Corson.
Next Steps: Neighborhood street fund opportunities

Progress Detail: Oxbow P-Patch opened in 2005
Challenges and barriers: Participation and ongoing maintenance; perception that Georgetown is unsafe to garden

Progress Detail: KC Sexual Assault Services maintains a full time presence at Stevenson; Georgetown Guardians organized to oversee sex offender housing; regular updates from the community police officer at our monthly meetings and on our list serve; Nighttime safety walks; neighborhood block watches organized; Georgetown Night Out established in 2008

Progress Detail: Designation is no longer a thing
